==Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nl|dum|verdienen}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|farthienon}}. Equivalent to {{prefix|nl|ver|dienen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/vərˈdinə(n)/|/vɛrˈdinə(n)/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-verdienen.ogg|audio}} * {{hyphenation|nl|ver|die|nen}} * {{rhymes|nl|inən}} ===Verb=== {{nl-verb}} # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[earn]] # {{lb|nl|transitive}} to [[deserve]] ====Inflection==== {{nl-conj-wk|pref=ver|dien}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|verdienen}}, from {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|firdionon}}; equivalent to {{prefix|de|ver|dienen}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/fɛɐ̯ˈdiːnən/}} * {{audio|de|De-verdienen.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-verdienen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-weak|verdient|verdiente|verdient}} # {{lb|de|transitive|intransitive}} to [[earn]] # {{lb|de|transitive|intransitive}} to [[make]] something (on something) # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[deserve]] something (for something) ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-weak|verdien|verdient|h}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Verdienen}} * {{l|de|Verdiener}} * {{l|de|Verdienst}} * {{l|de|gutverdienend}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
